ai.summary: A short, scenic circular walk around Brimham Rocks, a dramatic outcrop of gritstone in North Yorkshire. At about 3.5 km, the easy route is suitable for families and casual walkers, delivering dramatic rock formations and open countryside views.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly grassy and compact paths with some rocky sections along the rocks. Expect uneven surfaces, exposed rock ledges, and a few steps. Can be muddy after rain; good footwear recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Stay on marked paths and avoid climbing on the rock formations. Be mindful of loose stones and uneven ground, especially near the rock stacks. Weather can change quickly; bring waterproofs and warm clothing. Supervise children and keep pets under control. Take care on narrow/steep sections and watch for other walkers.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking boots with good grip
Weather-appropriate clothing (layered, waterproof if rain is forecast)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) for drier paths and longer daylight; the route can be walked year-round, but winter conditions may be muddy, icy, and more exposed.

seo.title: Circular Walk at Brimham Rocks – Easy 3.5km Hike in North Yorkshire, UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Brimham Rocks on a 3.5km circular hike. An easy route through striking gritstone formations in North Yorkshire, ideal for families and casual walkers.
seo.h1: Circular Walk at Brimham Rocks – 3.5km Easy Hike
